com.netflix.spectator.log4j

Class SpectatorAppender

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.logging.log4j.core.AbstractLifeCycle
      • org.apache.logging.log4j.core.filter.AbstractFilterable
        • org.apache.logging.log4j.core.appender.AbstractAppender
          • com.netflix.spectator.log4j.SpectatorAppender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.logging.log4j.core.Appender, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.filter.Filterable, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LifeCycle, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LifeCycle2

    @Plugin(name="Spectator",
        category="Core",
        elementType="appender",
        printObject=true)
public final class SpectatorAppender
extends org.apache.logging.log4j.core.appender.AbstractAppender
    Appender that tracks the number of messages that pass through. If the ignoreExceptions option is set to false, a more detailed counter for the number of stack traces with the exception types and file will also get tracked.

    • Method Detail

      • addToRootLogger

        public static void addToRootLogger(com.netflix.spectator.api.Registry registry,
                                   java.lang.String name,
                                   boolean ignoreExceptions)
        Add the spectator appender to the root logger. This method is intended to be called once as part of the applications initialization process.
        Parameters:
        registry - Spectator registry to use for the appender.
        name - Name for the appender.
        ignoreExceptions - If set to true then the stack trace metrics are disabled.

      • createAppender

public static SpectatorAppender createAppender(@PluginAttribute(value="name")

                                                              @PluginElement(value="Layout")
                                                              org.apache.logging.log4j.core.Layout<? extends java.io.Serializable> layout,
                                                              @PluginElement(value="Filters")
                                                              org.apache.logging.log4j.core.Filter filter)
        Create a new instance of the appender using the global spectator registry.
